THIS POSITION IS SUBJECT TO FUNDING
This position is offered subject to funding being approved through the federal Student Work Placement Program. Funding approval depends on several factors, including student eligibility.

To be eligible for this funding program you must be:

Registered in a Canadian post secondary education institution
Canadian citizen, permanent resident or person with refugee protection given under the law; and
Legally able to work in Canada according to the laws and regulations of the province or territory where you live
Hired as an employee, not as an independent contractor.

8 MONTH WORK TERM

Work Duration: 8 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms). Please ONLY apply if you are available for 8 months, and state your availability CLEARLY in your cover letter.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

Position: Embedded Electronics Engineer Co-op
Organization: Salyx
Duration: 8 months
Start date: May 1st, 2025
Location: Victoria, BC
Compensation: 3,020 gross monthly for working 40 hours per week

Company Description
Salyx is a MedTech company that develops innovative e-health IoT devices that connect to cloud services and mobile apps. Our ecosystem is part of a new Smart Monitoring Solution. The Salyx Health Device monitors more than five key health vital signals and warns the user of abnormal levels. Unlike other trackers in the industry, the Salyx Tracker requires minimal user intervention and brings the logging functionality of hospital technology right to your home.


Our company website

Job Description
We are looking for an Embedded Electronics Engineer to join our Hardware Development team. We are looking for an independent and self-driven Engineer who wants to see his contributions and knowledge have a significant impact on the product. You will work autonomously under the guidance of an experienced supervisor and will collaborate closely with a dedicated team of skilled engineers, fostering a dynamic feedback loop where you provide and receive high-level feedback.

Duties and Responsibilities

Develop firmware in C++, C for an IoT device to achieve mass production readiness.
Communication protocol development for cloud interaction including HTTP, MQTT.
Firmware update implementation through OTA

Contact
Please apply with your resume and transcript to hr@salyxmedical.com.

We believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are the foundation for innovation and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish - in an inclusive environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. As an equal-opportunity employer, Salyx Medical Inc encourages applications from all qualified individuals, including candidates from underrepresented groups and communities. We invite all qualified candidates to apply online with their resume and cover letter.

Knowledge and Skills

Experience with C and C++. Knowledge of Python is a must
Knowledge of serial communication protocols such as (UART, I2C, LIN)
Experience using Nordic microcontrollers, platform.io IDE and SoC microcontrollers
Experience with RTOS
Experience with version control systems (Git)
Able to read electronic schematics (KiCAD)
Experience with circuit troubleshooting, debugging, and diagnostics using multimeters, oscilloscopes, and other instrumentation is a plus
Knowledge of UL, FCC standards is recommended.
Wireless communication protocol knowledge is recommended.
Experience with PCB design and electronic circuits is a plus
Personal/Group Electronics projects are a plus
Excellent communication skills, self-managing, and detail-oriented
A desire to positively affect their environment
Self-organized and time-efficient.
Be able to work on independent projects from start to finish.

Academic Requirements
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Biomedical, Electrical, or Mechatronics in third year or above.

Other Requirements
Being a Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or have refugee status is required as this position is grant-funded by the Canadian Government.
